result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ZCI

Defendant Montanez Sm Miller in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Montanez Sm Miller in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Pl to amended chg in 13CF1643 - theft from person, Ct 2 DRI, as will 14CF201 and 14CF529. The State recommends prison but SS as to the amount.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Montanez Sm Miller in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Montanez Sm Miller in custody.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
There is a global offer and defensde asks for COP  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Montanez Sm Miller in court with attorney Robert William Peterson.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for Noah Wishau for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Marilyn Leedle.
Deft is in the same school, on the same bus with the co-actor. Deft is a high school student and defense is asking for bond modification to allow deft contact so he can go to school. The State
does not object to deft attending school but stresses no contact with the co-actor. Regarding the bracelet, Mr. Wishau did not raise said issue with Ms. Sommers prior to today and Ms. Sommers believes it remains appropriate.

BTC: GPS remains, but the Court will modify the bond to clarify that deft may have contact in terms of riding the bus and going to school with co-actor but he is not to have any verbal contact in any way.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.

***MODIFIED 02/19/2014***Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  House arrest except for court and atty appts.  No contact w/ S.L.J.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 03-14-2014 DEFEDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH THE CO-ACTOR ON THE BUS AND AT SCHOOL BUT IS TO HAVE ABSOLUTELY NO VERBAL CONTACT AT ALL**
for modification of bond
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
